apiKey.name: Authorization
apiKey.description:
To authenticate API calls with the API Key, set the Authorization HTTP header value as `Bearer API_KEY`.

Example: `Bearer 23813239889e947efd3e787cc41b0b839f442a85c5bfd30bd4b9a85ec3a54d5cae4d52b37ff52e64deb9c83bd04883812a6cebde04f2f25752f31be0ac74b514`.

You can create or find your API Key at [yelp.com](https://www.yelp.com/developers/v3/manage_app).

get.description:
This endpoint returns up to 1000 businesses with some basic information based on the provided search criteria.

**Note:** The API does not return businesses without any reviews.

parameters.description:
Required if either *latitude* or *longitude* is not provided.
This string indicates the geographic area to be used when searching for businesses.
Examples: "New York City", "NYC", "350 5th Ave, New York, NY 10118".
Businesses returned in the response may not be strictly within the specified location.
parameters.name: location

parameters.description: Required, if _location_ is not provided. Latitude of the location to search from. If latitude is provided, longitude is required too.
parameters.name: latitude

parameters.description: Required if _location_ is not provided. Longitude of the location to search from. If longitude is provided, latitude is required too.
parameters.name: longitude
term
parameters.description:
Search term, e.g. "food" or "restaurants".
The term may also be the business's name, such as "Starbucks". If term is not included the endpoint will default to searching across businesses from a small number of popular categories.

A suggested search radius in meters. This field is used as a suggestion to the search. The actual search radius may be lower than the suggested radius in dense urban areas, and higher in regions of less business density.
If the specified value is too large, a AREA_TOO_LARGE error may be returned. The max value is 40,000 meters (about 25 miles).
parameters.name: radius

parameters.description:
Categories to filter the search results with. See the list of supported categories. The category filter can be a list of comma delimited categories.
e.g., "bars,french" will filter by Bars OR French.
The category alias should be used (e.g. "discgolf", not "Disc Golf").
parameters.name: categories
locale
parameters.description: Locale code in the format of {language code}_{country code}. See the [list of supported locales](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/resources-supported-locales).

parameters.name: price
parameters.description:
Pricing levels to filter the search result with: 1 = $, 2 = $$, 3 = $$$, 4 = $$$$. The price filter can be a list of comma delimited pricing levels.
e.g., "1, 2, 3" will filter the results to show the ones that are $, $$, or $$$.

parameters.name: open_now
parameters.description:
When set to true, only return the businesses that are open now.
Notice that _open_at_ and _open_now_ cannot be used together.

parameters.name: open_at
parameters.description:
An integer representing the Unix time in the timezone of the search location. If specified, it will return businesses open at the given time.
Notice that *open_at* and *open_now* cannot be used together.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description:
Try these additional filters to return specific search results!
- *hot_and_new* - popular businesses which recently joined Yelp
- *request_a_quote* - businesses which actively reply to Request a Quote inquiries
- *reservation* - businesses with Yelp Reservations bookings enabled on their profile page
- *waitlist_reservation* - businesses with Yelp _Wait List_ bookings enabled on their profile screen (iOS/Android)
- *deals* - businesses offering Yelp Deals on their profile page
- *gender_neutral_restrooms* - businesses which provide gender neutral restrooms
- *open_to_all* - businesses which are Open To All
- *wheelchair_accessible* - businesses which are Wheelchair Accessible

**Yelp Fusion Premium tier** attributes, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/):
- Ambience
  - *ambience* - ambience of the business
  - *ambience_casual* - is the ambience at the business casual
  - *ambience_classy* - is the ambience at the business classy
  - *ambience_divey* - is the ambience at the business divey
  - *ambience_hipster* - is the ambience at the business hippy
  - *ambience_intimate* - is the ambience at the business intimate
  - *ambience_romantic* - is the ambience at the business romantic
  - *ambience_touristy* - is the ambience at the business touristy
  - *ambience_trendy* - is the ambience at the business trendy
  - *ambience_upscale* - is the ambience at the business upscale
- *dogs_allowed* - businesses which are Wheelchair Accessible
- *good_for_dancing* - businesses which are Wheelchair Accessible
- *happy_hour* - businesses which are Wheelchair Accessible
- Liked by
  - *liked_by_beer* - businesses liked by people who drink beer
  - *liked_by_dates* - businesses liked by people who are on a date
  - *liked_by_fifties* - businesses liked by people who are in their fiftees
  - *liked_by_forties* - businesses liked by people who are in their forties
  - *liked_by_genx* - businesses liked by people who belong to Generation X
  - *liked_by_thirties* - businesses liked by people who are in their thirties
  - *liked_by_twenties* - businesses liked by people who are in their twenties
  - *liked_by_men* - businesses liked by men
  - *liked_by_students* - businesses liked by Students
  - *liked_by_travelers* - businesses liked by people who are travelling
  - *liked_by_vegetarians* - businesses which are liked by vegetarians
  - *liked_by_wine* - businesses liked by people who drink wine
  - *liked_by_women* - businesses liked by women
  - *liked_by_young_professionals* - businesses liked by young prefessionals
- Noise level
  - *noise_level* - noise level at the business
  - *noise_level_average* - is the noise level average
  - *noise_level_loud* - is the noise level loud
  - *noise_level_quiet* - is the noise level quiet
  - *noise_level_very_loud* - is the noise level very loud
- *outdoor_seating* - businesses with outdoor seating areas
- Parking
  - *parking* - businesses with parking
  - *parking_garage* - businesses which itself has a garage or there is a parking garage nearby
  - *parking_lot* - businesses which have a parking lot
  - *parking_street* - businesses with street parking available nearby
  - *parking_valet* - businesses which offer a valet parking
  - *parking_validated* - businesses which can validate a parking ticket from an external parking
  - *parking_bike* - businesses with bike parking type
- *restaurants_delivery* - restaurants which offer delivery service
- *restaurants_takeout* - restaurants with take-out option
- WiFi
  - *wifi* - businesses with WiFi
  - *wifi_free* - businesses with free WiFi
  - *wifi_paid* - businesses with paid WiFi

You can combine multiple attributes by providing a comma separated like "attribute1,attribute2".
If multiple attributes are used, only businesses that satisfy all the attributes will be returned in search results.
e.g., the attributes "*hot_and_new*,*request_a_quote*" will return businesses that are 'Hot and New', and offer 'Request a Quote'.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Suggestion to the search algorithm that the results be sorted by one of the these modes: *best_match*, *rating*, *review_count* or *distance*.
The default is *best_match*. Note that specifying the sort_by is a suggestion (not strictly enforced) to Yelp's search, which considers multiple input parameters to return the most relevant results.

e.g., the *rating* sort is not strictly sorted by the rating value, but by an adjusted rating value that takes into account the number of ratings,
similar to a Bayesian average. This is to prevent skewing results to businesses with a single review.

parameters.name: device_platform
parameters.description: Determines the platform for mobile_link

parameters.name: reservation_date
parameters.description: The date for the reservation, format is YYYY-mm-dd

parameters.name: reservation_time
parameters.description: The time of the requested reservation, format is HH:MM

parameters.name: reservation_covers
parameters.description: How many people are attending the reservation

parameters.name: matches_party_size_param
parameters.description: Whether to filter out results that don't have openings matching the params

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset the list of returned results by this amount.

200.description: One more more businesses were found.

items.description: A Business Yelp finds based on the search criteria.

alias.description: Unique Yelp alias of this business. Can contain unicode characters. Example: 'yelp-san-francisco'. Also see What's the difference between the Yelp business ID and business alias?

image_url.description: URL of photo for this business

url.description: URL for business page on Yelp.

review_count.description: Number of reviews for this business.

categories.description: List of category title and alias pairs associated with this business.

items.description: Category that the business falls in.

alias.description: Alias of a category, when searching for business in certain categories, use alias rather than the title.

title.description: Title of a category for display purpose.

rating.description: Rating for this business (value ranges from 1, 1.5, ... 4.5, 5).

transactions.description: List of Yelp transactions that the business is registered for. Current supported values are **pickup**, **delivery** and **restaurant_reservation**.

price.description: Price level of the business. Uses the currency symbol of the provided locale. Value for en_US is one of *$*, *$$*, *$$$* or *$$$$*.

location.description: Location of this business, including address, city, state, zip code and country.

address2.description: Street address of this business, continued.

address3.description: Street address of this business, continued.

state.description: [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) (with a few [exceptions](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/resources-state-codes)) state code of this business.

display_address.description: Array of strings that if organized vertically give an address that is in the standard address format for the business's country.

display_phone.description: Phone number of the business formatted nicely to be displayed to users. The format is the standard phone number format for the business's country.

distance.description: Distance in meters from the search location. This value is in meters(m) regardless of the locale.

hours.description:
Regular business hours.

**Yelp Fusion Premium tier**, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/)

start.description: Start of the opening hours in a day, in [24-hour clock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24-hour_clock) notation, like 1000 means 10 AM.

end.description: End of the opening hours in a day, in [24-hour clock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24-hour_clock) notation, like 2130 means 9:30 PM.

is_overnight.description: Whether the special hours time range spans across midnight or not. When this is true, the end time will be lower than the start time.

is_open_now.description: Whether the business is open now

attributes.description:
Various features or facilities provided by the business.
**Yelp Fusion Premium tier** attributes, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/):
* *liked_by_vegetarians* - is the business liked by vegetarians
* *liked_by_vegans* - is the business liked by vegans
* *hot_and_new* - has the business recently joined Yelp

total.description: Total number of businesses Yelp finds based on the search criteria. Sometimes, the value may exceed 1000. In such case, you still can only get up to 1000 businesses using multiple queries and combinations of the "limit" and "offset" parameters.

region.description: Suggested area in a map to display results in.

400.description: Bad Request. Message varies depending on failure scenario

401.description:
The API key has either expired or doesn't have the required scopes to query this endpoint.

| code  | description |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| UNAUTHORIZED_API_KEY  | The API key provided is not currently able to query this endpoint.  |
| TOKEN_INVALID  | Invalid API key or authorization header.  |

error.description: The API key provided is not currently able to query this endpoint.
Invalid API key or authorization header.

403.description: The API key provided is not currently able to query this endpoint.

413.description: The length of the request exceeded the maximum allowed

429.description: You have either exceeded your daily quota, or have exceeded the queries-per-second limit for this endpoint. Try reducing the rate at which you make queries.

error.description: You have exceeded the queries-per-second limit for this endpoint. Try reducing the rate at which you make queries.
Something went wrong internally, please try again later.

get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of businesses based on the provided phone number. It is possible for more than one business to have the same phone number (for example, chain stores with the same +1 800 phone number).

Note: at this time, the API does not return businesses without any reviews.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Phone number of the business you want to search for. It must start with + and include the country code, like +14159083801.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale code in the format of {language code}_{country code}. See the [list of supported locales](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/resources-supported-locales).

Regular business hours.

**Yelp Fusion Premium tier**, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/)

get.description: This endpoint lets you match business data from other sources against businesses on Yelp, based on provided business information. For example, if you know a business's exact address and name, and you want to find that business only on Yelp. When should you use the Business Match endpoint? We have several endpoints that will return information on Yelp businesses. You should pick the endpoint to use based on how specific your input information is. * [Business Match endpoint](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/reference/v3_business_match) when you have precise info like name & address * [Business Search endpoint](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/reference/v3_business_search) when you have general info on the biz like name & location but don't know the address * [Phone Search endpoint](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/reference/v3_business_phone_search) when you only have the phone number or less confident about other matching criteria All of these endpoints return the same information about each business. **Note:** at this time, the API does not return businesses without any reviews.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the business. Only digits, letters, spaces, and !#$%&+,./:?@'are allowed.

parameters.name: address1
parameters.description: The first line of the business's address. Only digits, letters, spaces, and '/#&,.: are allowed. An empty string is allowed; this will specifically match certain service businesses that have no street address.

parameters.name: address2
parameters.description: The second line of the business's address. Only digits, letters, spaces, and '/#&,.: are allowed.

parameters.name: address3
parameters.description: The third line of the business's address. Only digits, letters, spaces, and '/#&,.: are allowed.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city of the business. Only digits, letters, spaces, and '.() are allowed.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) (with a few [exceptions](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/resources-state-codes)) state code of this business.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code of this business.

parameters.name: postal_code
parameters.description: The [Zip code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code) of this business.
Required, if _location_ is not provided. Latitude of the location to search from. If latitude is provided, longitude is required too.
parameters.name: latitude

parameters.description: Required if _location_ is not provided. Longitude of the location to search from. If longitude is provided, latitude is required too.
parameters.name: longitude
phone
parameters.description:
The phone number of the business which can be submitted as
(a) locally formatted with digits only (e.g., 016703080) or
(b) internationally formatted with a leading + sign and digits only after (+35316703080).

parameters.name: yelp_business_id
parameters.description: Unique Yelp identifier of the business if available. Used as a hint when finding a matching business.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return.

parameters.name: match_threshold
parameters.description:
Specifies whether a match quality threshold should be applied to the matched businesses. Must be one of the following.
**none:** Do not apply any match quality threshold; all potential business matches will be returned.
**default:** Apply a match quality threshold such that only very closely matching businesses will be returned.
**strict:** Apply a very strict match quality threshold.

200.description: One more more businesses were found.

alias.description:
Unique Yelp alias of this business. Can contain unicode characters.
Example: 'yelp-san-francisco'. Also see [What's the difference between the Yelp business ID and business alias](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/fusion-faq#whats-the-difference-between-the-yelp-business-id-and-business-alias)?

location.description: Location of this business, including address, city, state, zip code and country.

address2.description: Street address of this business, continued.

address3.description: Street address of this business, continued.

state.description: [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) (with a few [exceptions](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/resources-state-codes)) state code of this business.

display_address.description: Array of strings that if organized vertically give an address that is in the standard address format for the business's country.

display_phone.description: Phone number of the business formatted nicely to be displayed to users. The format is the standard phone number format for the business's country.

get.description:
This endpoint returns detailed business content.
Normally, you would get the Business ID from [/v3/businesses/search](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/reference/v3_business_search), [/v3/businesses/search/phone](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/reference/v3_business_phone_search), [/v3/transactions/{transaction_type}/search](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/reference/v3_transaction_search) or [/v3/autocomplete](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/reference/v3_autocomplete).
To retrieve review excerpts for a business, please refer to our Reviews endpoint ([/v3/businesses/{id}/reviews](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/reference/v3_business_reviews))

**Note:** at this time, the API does not return businesses without any reviews.

parameters.name: business_id_or_alias
parameters.description: A unique identifier for a Yelp Business. Can be either a 22-character Yelp Business ID, or a Yelp Business Alias.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale code in the format of {language code}_{country code}. See the [list of supported locales](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/resources-supported-locales).

parameters.name: device_platform
parameters.description: Determines the platform for mobile_link

200.description: A Business with the requested Id was returned.

schema.description: A full representation of a business

allOf.description: A Business Yelp finds based on the search criteria.

alias.description: Unique Yelp alias of this business. Can contain unicode characters. Example: 'yelp-san-francisco'. Also see What's the difference between the Yelp business ID and business alias?

image_url.description: URL of photo for this business

url.description: URL for business page on Yelp.

review_count.description: Number of reviews for this business.

categories.description: List of category title and alias pairs associated with this business.

items.description: Category that the business falls in.

alias.description: Alias of a category, when searching for business in certain categories, use alias rather than the title.

title.description: Title of a category for display purpose.

rating.description: Rating for this business (value ranges from 1, 1.5, ... 4.5, 5).

transactions.description: List of Yelp transactions that the business is registered for. Current supported values are **pickup**, **delivery** and **restaurant_reservation**.

price.description: Price level of the business. Uses the currency symbol of the provided locale. Value for en_US is one of *$*, *$$*, *$$$* or *$$$$*.

location.description: Location of this business, including address, city, state, zip code and country.

address2.description: Street address of this business, continued.

address3.description: Street address of this business, continued.

state.description: [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) (with a few [exceptions](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/resources-state-codes)) state code of this business.

display_address.description: Array of strings that if organized vertically give an address that is in the standard address format for the business's country.

display_phone.description: Phone number of the business formatted nicely to be displayed to users. The format is the standard phone number format for the business's country.

distance.description: Distance in meters from the search location. This value is in meters(m) regardless of the locale.

hours.description:
Regular business hours.

**Yelp Fusion Premium tier**, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/)

start.description: Start of the opening hours in a day, in [24-hour clock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24-hour_clock) notation, like 1000 means 10 AM.

end.description: End of the opening hours in a day, in [24-hour clock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24-hour_clock) notation, like 2130 means 9:30 PM.

is_overnight.description: Whether the special hours time range spans across midnight or not. When this is true, the end time will be lower than the start time.

is_open_now.description: Whether the business is open now

attributes.description:
Various features or facilities provided by the business.
**Yelp Fusion Premium tier** attributes, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/):
* *liked_by_vegetarians* - is the business liked by vegetarians
* *liked_by_vegans* - is the business liked by vegans
* *hot_and_new* - has the business recently joined Yelp

is_claimed.description: Whether business has been claimed by a business owner

photos.description:
URLs of up to three photos of the business.

URLs of up to twelve photos of the business are available for **[Yelp Fusion Premium tier](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/)** users

special_hours.description: Out of the ordinary hours for the business that apply on certain dates. Whenever these are set, they will override the regular business hours found in the 'hours' field.

date.description: An [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date string representing the date for which these special hours apply.

start.description: Start of the opening hours in a day, in [24-hour clock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24-hour_clock) notation, like 1000 means 10 AM.

end.description: End of the opening hours in a day, in [24-hour clock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24-hour_clock) notation, like 2130 means 9:30 PM.

is_overnight.description: Whether the special hours time range spans across midnight or not. When this is true, the end time will be lower than the start time.

is_closed.description: Whether this particular special hour represents a date where the business is closed.

messaging.description: Information and action links for messaging with this business via Yelp, including requesting quotes.

url.description: Visit this action link URL to go directly into the business messaging flow for this business.

use_case_text.description: Indicates what kind of messaging can be done with the business. e.g., "Request a Quote" for a home services business, or "Request a Consultation" for a legal services business. This text will be localized (see Localization).

response_rate.description:
Float number between 0 and 1, where 0 is never replies and 1 is always replies.

Yelp Fusion Premium tier, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/)

response_time.description:
Estimated response time in seconds.

Yelp Fusion Premium tier, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/)

is_enabled.description: Whether messaging is currently enabled. Access is disabled by default. See [Yelp Partner APIs](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/yelp-partner-apis) on how to get access.

photo_count.description:
Total number of photos

Yelp Fusion Premium tier, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/)

photo_details.description:
List of photo details

Yelp Fusion Premium tier, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/)

yelp_menu_url.description:
Business menu URL

Yelp Fusion Premium tier, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/)

cbsa.description:
Core based statistical area.

Knowledge Premium attribute, please apply [here](https://knowledge.yelp.com/get-started/)

popularity_score.description:
Indicates popularity of a business with respect to other businesses belonging to the same primary category.

Knowledge Premium attributes, please apply [here](https://knowledge.yelp.com/get-started/)

rapc.description: Information about Request a Phone Call for this business. Access is disabled by default. See [Yelp Partner APIs](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/yelp-partner-apis) on how to get access.

is_enabled.description: Whether Request a Phone Call is currently enabled. Request a Phone Call can be toggled via the [Enable/Disable Request a Phone Call endpoint](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/reference/v3_business_rapc_enabledness).

is_eligible.description: Whether the given business is eligible for Request a Phone Call. The [Enable/Disable Request a Phone Call endpoint](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/reference/v3_business_rapc_enabledness) can only be used if the business is eligible.

400.description: Bad Request. Message varies depending on failure scenario

get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of businesses which support requested transaction type.

**Note:**
* At this time, the API does not return businesses without any reviews.
* Currently, this endpoint only supports food delivery in the US.

parameters.name: transaction_type
parameters.description: Type of transaction supported by the business
Required, if _location_ is not provided. Latitude of the location to search from. If latitude is provided, longitude is required too.
parameters.name: latitude

parameters.description: Required if _location_ is not provided. Longitude of the location to search from. If longitude is provided, latitude is required too.
parameters.name: longitude

parameters.description:
Required if either *latitude* or *longitude* is not provided.
This string indicates the geographic area to be used when searching for businesses.
Examples: "New York City", "NYC", "350 5th Ave, New York, NY 10118".
Businesses returned in the response may not be strictly within the specified location.
parameters.name: location
term
parameters.description:
Search term, e.g. "food" or "restaurants".
The term may also be the business's name, such as "Starbucks". If term is not included the endpoint will default to searching across businesses from a small number of popular categories.

Categories to filter the search results with. See the list of supported categories. The category filter can be a list of comma delimited categories.
e.g., "bars,french" will filter by Bars OR French.
The category alias should be used (e.g. "discgolf", not "Disc Golf").
parameters.name: categories
price
parameters.description:
Pricing levels to filter the search result with: 1 = $, 2 = $$, 3 = $$$, 4 = $$$$. The price filter can be a list of comma delimited pricing levels.
e.g., "1, 2, 3" will filter the results to show the ones that are $, $$, or $$$.

200.description: Transaction data for one or more businesses was returned.

items.description: A Business Yelp finds based on the search criteria.

alias.description: Unique Yelp alias of this business. Can contain unicode characters. Example: 'yelp-san-francisco'. Also see What's the difference between the Yelp business ID and business alias?

image_url.description: URL of photo for this business

url.description: URL for business page on Yelp.

review_count.description: Number of reviews for this business.

categories.description: List of category title and alias pairs associated with this business.

items.description: Category that the business falls in.

alias.description: Alias of a category, when searching for business in certain categories, use alias rather than the title.

title.description: Title of a category for display purpose.

rating.description: Rating for this business (value ranges from 1, 1.5, ... 4.5, 5).

transactions.description: List of Yelp transactions that the business is registered for. Current supported values are **pickup**, **delivery** and **restaurant_reservation**.

price.description: Price level of the business. Uses the currency symbol of the provided locale. Value for en_US is one of *$*, *$$*, *$$$* or *$$$$*.

location.description: Location of this business, including address, city, state, zip code and country.

address2.description: Street address of this business, continued.

address3.description: Street address of this business, continued.

state.description: [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) (with a few [exceptions](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/resources-state-codes)) state code of this business.

display_address.description: Array of strings that if organized vertically give an address that is in the standard address format for the business's country.

display_phone.description: Phone number of the business formatted nicely to be displayed to users. The format is the standard phone number format for the business's country.

distance.description: Distance in meters from the search location. This value is in meters(m) regardless of the locale.

hours.description:
Regular business hours.

**Yelp Fusion Premium tier**, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/)

start.description: Start of the opening hours in a day, in [24-hour clock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24-hour_clock) notation, like 1000 means 10 AM.

end.description: End of the opening hours in a day, in [24-hour clock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24-hour_clock) notation, like 2130 means 9:30 PM.

is_overnight.description: Whether the special hours time range spans across midnight or not. When this is true, the end time will be lower than the start time.

is_open_now.description: Whether the business is open now

attributes.description:
Various features or facilities provided by the business.
**Yelp Fusion Premium tier** attributes, please apply [here](https://fusion.yelp.com/enterprise/apply/):
* *liked_by_vegetarians* - is the business liked by vegetarians
* *liked_by_vegans* - is the business liked by vegans
* *hot_and_new* - has the business recently joined Yelp

total.description: Total number of businesses Yelp finds based on the search criteria. Sometimes, the value may exceed 1000. In such case, you still can only get up to 1000 businesses using multiple queries and combinations of the "limit" and "offset" parameters.

400.description: Bad Request. Message varies depending on failure scenario

get.description:
Returns engagement metrics information for the provided businesses.
This endpoint requires special permissions to be enabled for your Yelp Fusion API Key.

parameters.name: business_ids
parameters.description: Business Id or alias of the businesses for which to get data.

parameters.name: date_range_start
parameters.description: Start of the date range during which to get metrics. Defaults to the beginning of the most recently available week.

parameters.name: date_range_end
parameters.description: End of the date range during which to get metrics. Defaults to the end of the most recently available week.

200.description: Engagement metrics for one or more businesses were returned.

start_of_week_date.description: Start date of the week for which metrics was requested.

engagement_metric.description: Score on a scale of 1-20 to measure consumer engagement of a particular business

intent_metric.description: Score on a scale of 1-10 to measure consumer intent of a particular business

transaction_metric.description: Score on a scale of 1-4 to measure consumer transaction with a particular business

get.description:
Returns active and eligible service offerings for a business.
This endpoint requires special permissions to be enabled for your Yelp Fusion API Key.

parameters.name: business_id_or_alias

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale code in the format of {language code}_{country code}. See the [list of supported locales](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/resources-supported-locales).

eligible.description: List of all service offerings that the business is eligible for

post.description:
This endpoint lets you enable or disable Request a Phone Call for a particular business. Check whether the business is eligible using the [Get business by ID](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/reference/v3_business_info) endpoint and inspecting the *rapc* object.

*Example*:
To enable Request a Phone call for a Business with ID "loPSlzp6M628rzyCRPqrv3tC", send an [authenticated](https://docs.developer.yelp.com/docs/authorization-code-workflow) POST request to the URL:
https://api.yelp.com/v3/businesses/loPSlzp6M628rzyCRPqrv3tC/rapc_enabledness with the following request body:

```json
{
    "is_enabled": true,
}
```

For the above request, a successful POST call will return a 202 accepted response.

parameters.name: business_id_or_alias
parameters.description: A unique identifier for a Yelp Business. Can be either a 22-character Yelp Business ID, or a Yelp Business Alias.

202.description: The RaPC status has been set.

400.description: Bad Request. Message varies depending on failure scenario

post.description: This endpoint takes in a natural language query and responds with the businesses matching it

schema.description: Request options for natural language search

messages.description: Array of natural language message objects

content.description: Natural language content of the message

location.description: The geographic area to be used when searching for businesses. Examples- "New York City", "NYC", "350 5th Ave, New
location.name: location

latitude.description: Latitude of the location to search from. If latitude is provided, longitude is required too
latitude.name: latitude

longitude.description: Longitude of the location to search from. If longitude is provided, latitude is required too.
longitude.name: longitude

timezone.description: Timezone of the user. This field is required when the user uses a time-aware feature. Example value- America/New_York.

200.description: Successful response for natural language search.

location.description: Business location, including address, city, state, zip code and country

address2.description: Street address of the business, continued.

address3.description: Street address of the business, continued.

country.description: The [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code of the location of the business. Country the business is in.

display_address.description: Array of strings that if organized vertically give an address that is in the standard address format for the business' country.

coordinates.description: Business coordinates. An object with latitude and longitude.

review_count.description: Number of reviews that business has

items.description: Category that the business falls in.

alias.description: Alias of a category, when searching for business in certain categories, use alias rather than the title.

title.description: Title of a category for display purpose.

attributes.description: Map of business attribute to its value (e.g. noise_level -> mild)

summary.description: AI generated 1 sentence summary from reviews that captures the business relevance & specialties, currently only support Restaurants & Nightlife

photos.description: Array of contextual business photos. Max 3 photos per business

url.description: URL for business page on Yelp

businesses.description: Array of business objects that satisfy the user's query. Max 3 businesses

businesses.summary: French brasserie in Williamsburg known for steak frites and mushroom pate.

businesses.name: Vineapple
businesses.review_snippet: Was delicious and had a nice chewy texture. Everything tasted amazing. I loved the [[HIGHLIGHT]]breakfast[[ENDHIGHLIGHT]]...
businesses.summary: Cozy cafe offering strong frozen drinks and flavorful breakfast options.
